poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The last lady gone, her man is ill - what though He owns the city. Proof of which He lays him down on the random pavement. Plain-clothes social security men around him so discrete They don't know who it is or that they're guarding. Booze companies spend billions to attract and keep his custom; THe wealthy want assurances, he won't return their calls For he is her man.
